instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PUBS_G3H: What is PUBS_G3H? This is a typo of PPBUS_G3H When you see PUBS_G3H, assume they meant to type PPBUS_G3H.
definitions.SMC_WIFI_PWR_EN: What is SMC_WIFI_PWR_EN? SMC_WIFI_PWR_EN is a signal that turns on power to the wifi circuit when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wifi issue
threads.message:
Hello, I have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> which had slight water damage and was not turning on at all, was changed some corroded resistors and reballed SMC. Now it fully works, but has no wifi and cooler spins on max RPM.

please help, what algorithm should I go throw? Thank you

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wifi issue
threads.message: could be a faulty SMC,,,, Voltage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> without battery, try another trackpad and flex...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wifi issue
threads.message:
No Title

on <SIGNAL>PUBS_G3H</SIGNAL> I have 8.6v without battery. tried other touchpad and keyboard+flex, 2 errors gone :) only wifi left.

but tried wifi boards, its problem in main board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wifi issue
threads.message: Power to Airport present on <CAPACITOR>C3521</CAPACITOR>? <SIGNAL>SMC_WIFI_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> checked if power is not there?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wifi issue
threads.message: i had similar issue, <CHIP>U3550</CHIP> wifi switch was shorted to gnd. I had to replace the wifi card too, it was shorted too and that killed <CHIP>U3550</CHIP>, before u replace it measure both sides to gnd if 0 ohm or not
